newsitem.title: CHINA: China dissident back in jail after suicide attempt.
newsitem.headline: China dissident back in jail after suicide attempt.

text.p: Chinese dissident Chen Longde, who attempted suicide in August by jumping from a third-floor window, has been sent back to a labour camp, family members said on Monday.

Chen's family has received police notification that the dissident was discharged from hospital on November 28 and sent to a labour camp in Jinhua city in the eastern province of Zhejiang, his 74-year-old mother, Ren Yueqin, said.
"I'm really worried. He (Chen) is ill. His leg is not yet fully recovered," Ren told Reuters by telephone from Hangzhou, capital of the eastern coastal province of Zhejiang.
Chen broke his right leg and smashed three teeth after jumping out of the window because he could not stand alleged beating by prison officials, family members have said.
"He is still using crutches... It still hurts when he walks," his sister said by telephone. "We requested that he be released on bail but they (authorities) refused."
The mother said she begged to be allowed to meet the dissident but police refused her request.

Chen, 39, was detained last May and ordered two months later to serve three years in a labour camp for "endangering national security" by sending a petition to parliament demanding the release of political prisoners.
He was previously jailed for three years for his role in student-led demonstrations crushed by the army on June 4, 1989, in Beijing.
